unit_obj_eq_map_unit:
/-
Copyright (c) 2020 Bhavik Mehta. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Bhavik Mehta
-/
-- TODO: This holds more generally for idempotent adjunctions, not just reflective adjunctions.
/-- For a reflective functor `i` (with left adjoint `L`), with unit `η`, we have `η_iL = iL η`.
-/
theorem unit_obj_eq_map_unit [reflective i] (X : C) :
    (of_right_adjoint i).unit.app (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj X)) =
      i.map ((left_adjoint i).map ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app X)) :=
  by
  rw [← cancel_mono (i.map ((of_right_adjoint i).counit.app ((left_adjoint i).obj X))), ← i.map_comp]
  simp
#align unit_obj_eq_map_unit unit_obj_eq_map_unit
unit_is_iso:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⋙ » -/
/-- If `A` is essentially in the image of a reflective functor `i`, then `η_A` is an isomorphism.
This gives that the "witness" for `A` being in the essential image can instead be given as the
reflection of `A`, with the isomorphism as `η_A`.

(For any `B` in the reflective subcategory, we automatically have that `ε_B` is an iso.)
-/
theorem functor.ess_image.unit_is_iso [reflective i] {A : C} (h : A ∈ i.ess_image) :
    IsIso ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A) :=
  by
  suffices
    (of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A =
      «expr ≫ » h.get_iso.inv
        («expr ≫ » ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app (i.obj h.witness)) ((«expr ⋙ » (left_adjoint i) i).map h.get_iso.hom))
    by
    rw [this]
    infer_instance
  rw [← nat_trans.naturality]
  simp
#align functor.ess_image.unit_is_iso functor.ess_image.unit_is_iso
unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_natural:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
theorem unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_natural [reflective i] (A : C) {B B' : C} (h : «expr ⟶ » B B')
    (hB : B ∈ i.ess_image) (hB' : B' ∈ i.ess_image) (f : «expr ⟶ » (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj A)) B) :
    (unit_comp_partial_bijective A hB').symm («expr ≫ » f h) =
      «expr ≫ » ((unit_comp_partial_bijective A hB).symm f) h :=
  by simp
#align unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_natural unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_natural
unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_apply:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
@[simp]
theorem unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_apply [reflective i] (A : C) {B : C} (hB : B ∈ i.ess_image) (f) :
    (unit_comp_partial_bijective A hB).symm f = «expr ≫ » ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A) f := by
  simp [unit_comp_partial_bijective, unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux_symm_apply]
#align unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_apply unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_apply
unit_comp_partial_bijective_natural:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
theorem unit_comp_partial_bijective_natural [reflective i] (A : C) {B B' : C} (h : «expr ⟶ » B B')
    (hB : B ∈ i.ess_image) (hB' : B' ∈ i.ess_image) (f : «expr ⟶ » A B) :
    (unit_comp_partial_bijective A hB') («expr ≫ » f h) = «expr ≫ » (unit_comp_partial_bijective A hB f) h := by
  rw [← equiv.eq_symm_apply, unit_comp_partial_bijective_symm_natural A h, equiv.symm_apply_apply]
#align unit_comp_partial_bijective_natural unit_comp_partial_bijective_natural
unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux_symm_app:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/-- The description of the inverse of the bijection `unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux`. -/
theorem unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux_symm_apply [reflective i] {A : C} {B : D}
    (f : «expr ⟶ » (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj A)) (i.obj B)) :
    (unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux _ _).symm f = «expr ≫ » ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A) f := by
  simp [unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux]
#align unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux_symm_apply unit_comp_partial_bijective_aux_symm_apply
mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⟶ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr𝟭» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ⋙ » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr ≫ » -/
/-- If `η_A` is a split monomorphism, then `A` is in the reflective subcategory. -/
theorem mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono [reflective i] {A : C} [is_split_mono ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A)] :
    A ∈ i.ess_image :=
  by
  let η : «expr ⟶ » ((«expr𝟭») C) («expr ⋙ » (left_adjoint i) i) := (of_right_adjoint i).unit
  haveI : is_iso (η.app (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj A))) := (i.obj_mem_ess_image _).unit_is_iso
  have : epi (η.app A) := by
    apply epi_of_epi (retraction (η.app A)) _
    rw [show «expr ≫ » (retraction _) (η.app A) = _ from η.naturality (retraction (η.app A))]
    apply epi_comp (η.app (i.obj ((left_adjoint i).obj A)))
  skip
  haveI := is_iso_of_epi_of_is_split_mono (η.app A)
  exact mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_iso A
#align mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_split_mono
mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_iso:
/-- If `η_A` is an isomorphism, then `A` is in the essential image of `i`. -/
theorem mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_iso [is_right_adjoint i] (A : C) [IsIso ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A)] :
    A ∈ i.ess_image :=
  ⟨(left_adjoint i).obj A, ⟨(asIso ((of_right_adjoint i).unit.app A)).symm⟩⟩
#align mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_iso mem_ess_image_of_unit_is_iso
